intro: Hibbertia crispula, commonly known as the waxy hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with red centers and hairy, waxy leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is found in regions such as New South Wales and Queensland. Hibbertia crispula is part of the Dilleniaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. It thrives in full sun and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
